Posts.Content: On Jun 13, 2014 2:57 PM sherlaud wrote: On Jun 12, 2014 10:48 PM Akitalover11 wrote: I couldn't agree with you More! I remember before BC nurse telling me my estrogen levels off the chart. I did eat a lot of soy and was on prempro for a short time. I wish I knew then what I know now. My son is a wellness expert, holistic healing through nutrition and supplements, herbal tinctures. I always had soy whey protein in my smoothies too. Have you ever heard of leaky gut? Every disease starts in our guts. No, I have never heard of "leaky gut"???  What IS it??  Curious to know.  I LOVE that - before "BC"!!!  I do that all the time - "BC" (before cancer) and then "AC" (after cancer)......Sorry I haven't been on here for awhile. Leaky gut, intestinal permeability. Look up the SCD diet, specific carbohydrate diet. That explains a lot.
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: Very good point. Whole good fats, avacado, coconut oil, ghee, nuts, grass fed butter. Incorporate that in your diet.
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: I couldn't agree with you More! I remember before BC nurse telling me my estrogen levels off the chart. I did eat a lot of soy and was on prempro for a short time. I wish I knew then what I know now. My son is a wellness expert, holistic healing through nutrition and supplements, herbal tinctures. I always had soy whey protein in my smoothies too. Have you ever heard of leaky gut? Every disease starts in our guts.
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: Wow that is so awesome! Very strong lady to do those cleanses. I am on day 15 grain free. Gluten is like lead in my stomach now. There are two books Wheat Belly and Grain Brain. We are likely to gain weight around our waist while on this medicine( and our ages contribute ) which is unhealthy and produces more estrogen. Catch 22. I am in a study with UCSD learning about weight gain and healthy living battling the slower metabolism and everything that goes along with taking this drug.just a side note. Probiotics excellent! Let me know how you're feeling, I'm interested
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: On Jun 03, 2014 3:45 PM cancerkeys wrote: Hi, I was wondering if there was anyone who thinks they may know how they got an estrogen receptive breast cancer. I've talked to several women, and they all think they know how they got it. I have a feeling too because I have no family history of it. Between the ages of 20 and 30 I went vegetarian and consumed mainly soy products. I thought I was doing good for myself. I ate veggie burgers, meatless chicken, tofu, edamame, soy sausages....etc. I ate them EVERY day! I know they say soy mimics estrogen so am thinking this may be what triggered my cells to go crazy. Some things I read says plant matter can't do that. I just feel in my gut that this is how I got it. After 30 I ate meat again. But as I try and find the source of the meat, most of it is grain fed.....most of that grain being soy! The chickens are fed grains....soy. The eggs from free range chickens are fed grains....soy! My lotions contain soy! Why does every darned thing I try to eat contain soy! I tried to do better and am left confused by food. Other women ER positive tell me they were on hormone replacement therapy and think that caused it. Another believes it was the hormones in her birth control pills. I am just curious if others have that "feeling" that they know what caused them to get this? I was 41 (2012) when I had a 3.5 cm tumor in my left breast. I opted for bi lateral mastectomy. My tumor was close to my chest wall but the surgeon got clean margines. I had 9 lymph nodes removed and 3 had cancer. I was stage 2 but borderline 3. I did 4 rounds of chemo and 36 radiation treatments. I was on tamoxifen for almost a year which made me have a hysterectomy and ovaries removed. I also was having problems with my vision. I couldn't focus my eyes. I switched to arimadex a month ago and hate it already. I have had neck pain and pain between my shoulder blades that has floored me and I can't do anything. My right foot also feels like it is broken. I am just wondering what and how others feel about food........Hi I would like to say that as far as the Arimidex and Aromisin are concerned, I'm with you on that. I have had so many side effects, I cannot walk barefoot feels like I'm walking on my bones! I have extreme bone, joint pain, fatigue muscle aches. My doctor gives me two norco per day just to participate, otherwise I just couldn't get through the day. This October will be my five year mark on this drug, andni wonder if my life will be pain free? I know the scar tissue will be there, but I will go from 95 back to 61 years old maybe??
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: Yes BC, before cancer is right! Google solving leaky gut. I will get back to you with literature and any information or questions you have I will find out for you and/or put you in contact with my son who has a degree in Integreative Health Studies and Nutrition
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: On Jun 15, 2014 1:09 AM SpringFlowers wrote: To Movin slow -  You should avoid soy at all costs.   Soy is ok if you do not have cancer, but once you have cancer, you must avoid soy.  Cancer feeds from mucus. No, milk, sugar, best to stay on a natural foods diet.  Cancer is due to PH negativity in the body, keep your body PH at 6 or above and cancer cannot live or thrive in an oxygenated enviornment.  I have done much research in the 6 yrs since being DX'd.  I've found most oncologists are in the dark explaining what cancer is, why it thrives and how to get it out.  I was told I would not see 2012, and I needed to consider putting my affairs in order and visiting friends and family....otherwords, go plan my funeral.  If i'd listened to oncologists, I would be in the ground.  When first dx'dw/DCIS,pr/er positive told I need mastectomy, chemo/radiation/reconstruction, the routine...well, i'm not one for body mutiliation, so I did research, found an oncologist/breast surgeon in NewYork who has been doing Laser Surgery.  Has been named doctor of the year twice in NY State, results show a better outcome with hardly any recurrence of cancer vs. standard surgical removal.  Also, less chance of cancer cells escaping into the body and reestablishing new territory.  As for the cause, I had genetic testing, long interviews...I'd had lyme disease, then ChronicFatigue Syndrome, then debilitating arthritis, which I still have, but it is INFLAMMATION that causes most diseases, heart disease, and I believe also cancer.    I wish you all the best, but do stay focused on YOU, do the research, learn all you can - Read:  Genocide -The Cancer Coverup/Kathleen Deoul, If I can help further, please buzz in.  God Bless....( LaserBreastCancerSurgery.com "" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://LaserBreastCancerSurgery.com " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">LaserBreastCancerSurgery.com )I immediately called and went....no paid, no cutting, no body mutiliation, I kept my breast, removed the tumor, got clear margins, got  up off the table after surgery, went to dinner that night, flew  home 3 days later.   My reports had stated I was already Stage 4 - thanks to a misread mammogram that missed the tumor, so why would I believe more garbage from oncolgoist????  I saw my scans, read the reports.  I had 8 -9mm tumors in my lungs,liver, all soft tissue, plus invasion in my spine, pelvis, ribs.  I opted for natural, within 3 months I had rid my body of all soft tissue tumors and pronounced secondary remission, I still had invasion in my spine and pelvis, but the ribs invasion was gone.  I then opten for CSCI, I've had reduction with this remedy, but will have to go through it again, still, it beats the misery of medical hacking.  Yes, i'm a bit snarky, but it was the brilliant medical world not paying attention that caused this misery, then they want to further inflict more misery.  Cancer is all about the money...many of us on this site have learned that secret.  I'd advise you google Mina Bissell/TED--she is a top cancer researcher, then go to Ben Goodacre, listen intently, learn what cancer really is and how to beat it.  It can be done.  I am now healthy, no fatigue, no health issues, my tumor markers are all normal, all stats/bloodwork are normal.  Onco's said it couldn't be done without chemo -  But, they don't tell you chemo kills more people than the actual cancer.  Causes heart attacks, host of problems, radiation causes the heart muscles to harden and leads to heart failure.  Keeping the body PH in check is the secret.  I got all my soft tissue void of tumors using the Kelmun Protocol and also the Aspargus puree - which is same ingredients in Indole 3/Carbinol, which you should be taking, along with other cancer fighers, keep your immune system in good working order and it will do more to cure the cancer than anything any onco can offer.  They know it, but who wants to give up a million or more to keep the cancer industy going than admit there are other ways to health without the miserable side effects.  I still have cancer, but it is completely under control and I will not let it rule my life, my onco is amazed, asks me what i've done, I know that research and learning everything possible is the key, not following protocol that brings in the big bucks.  You have to be determined and learn everything there is about the enemy, and you can win.  I have and I will continue to do so. Very awesome You have taken control of your life. Sugar is cancers friend. Remember that everyone
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: Did you ever find out any information on the class action law suit?
Posts.Title: Are you Estrogen positive Breast cancer and think you know what caused it?

Posts.Content: I just completed my 5yr regime of Arimidex, then switched to Aromisin. The side effects, bone and joint pain, weight gain around middle, foot pain is still with me after two weeks. Anyone else feeling better after stopping this medication? My onc said it should be out of my system in a week or so. Still feels like my feet are on fire.
Posts.Title: Post Aromisin/Arimidex side effects...how much longer?

Posts.Content: I feel so stupid sometimes trying to explain my symptoms to my Dr or just about anyone. Please tell me I am not alone with bad foot bone joint pain from these drugs? Fatigue and muscle aches too. My dr says as long as I can tolerate it, it has benefit. This October will be my 5 year mark on it. I am lucky I have a grown son who is a holistic nutritionist and in acupuncture school. However, I survive on Motrin 600 and up to two Norco to get through each day. Anyone else feeling the se from this medicine? I try to exercise regularly if I can walk, and it always helps.
Posts.Title: SE of Aromisin and Arimidex

Posts.Content: On Jan 05, 2016 10:50 PM terimccollum wrote: I have been reading about others that sound like they are experiencing the same pain i am having after a year and a half. I was just prescribed hydroconone but when the pain comes i might be out and about or just sitting watching tv and i dont want to even move. Sometimes its intense itching of one breast and the pain from the arm is a burning type, unbearable.I am wondering if my body is rejecting the silicone breast, but at this time i am deciding to try for social security disability at age 61, but dont know if this is a very well known disability. Cant possibly work again with this horrible off and on pain.Help "" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://pain.Help " target="_blank" rel="nofollow">pain.Help !I was diagnosed in April 2010, dblmx, 6 rounds chemo, high onco score, reconstruction, just completed 5 years of Arimidex and Aromisin. Thank goodness that part is over. The bone and hip pain has gotten better. I take 1 1/2 norco/day and one Motrin. Same symptoms and age as you. I am on ssdi, they gave it to me within two weeks. You are not alone, believe me! I tried a new exercise program today, lifting weights and stretching my upper body to try to get stronger again. It is an uphill battle, but so very thankful I am still here to talk about it
Posts.Title: post mastectomy pain from oct 2014 and still going

Posts.Content: On Feb 21, 2008 12:00 AM Moon_Masque wrote: P.S. - I recently read an article regarding the use of dogs in detecting certain types of cancer.  The study is revealing amazing results.  Hopefully in the future it will become another tool for the early detection of cancer. Blessings, Moon Masque   My dog detected my breast cancer. She out of the blue started washing my arm like a mother cat which was unusual. I was going to put off my mammogram for six months, but thought something of this and got right in. I ended up with a very agressive tumor, and luckily we caught it. I love my white Akita, by my side every day
Posts.Title: Cancer smell

Posts.Content: I see posts from years past, but is anyone else going through the horrible joint, feet and hand pain from aromisin ? It is so bad for me that I take one Norco every morning just to have a life ! I have also gained belly fat and it scares me because it is so bad for us. I had bilateral masectomy in May 2010, with 6 rounds of chemo, then arimidex for one year , then switched to aromisin. It is progressively getting worse. My onc says it is increasing my survival rate but I am 57 feeling like I'm 90:(
Posts.Title: Side effects of aromisin and weight gain

Posts.Content: On Feb 28, 2013 6:23 AM janemettee wrote: On Feb 26, 2013 11:06 PM AyJayBeeGee wrote: Has anyone else on Arimidex had recurring trigger thumb? I noticed on the information from the pharmacy that it is a rare side effect. I have just completed my first year of daily anastrozole (arimidex) and am having a lot of problem with trigger thumb.I had tendinitis in both thumbs and pain in both wrists and carpal tunnel I had joint pain all over but so bad in my wrists I needed to use two hands to pick up a cup of coffee. After going to my primary MD and an orthopedist I realized it was from the Arimidex and I went to my oncologist who took me off the med for 3 weeks. He then put me on Aromisin which has been easier to tolerate. It works a little different. I still had joint pain and stiffness for 31/2 years. About 2 months ago the pain went away leaving me with only stiffness. ....I will be finished with it in 14 months. I wonder if the stiffness will go away or if this is the new me. My joints feel older than the rest of my body. I used Naprosin for pain relief. I am happy to have good treatments and glad to be alive but it is at best annoying. JaneI like that "at best annoying", I have had carpal tunnel surgery since being on Aromisin. My joints in my hands and feet are stiff and painful. It makes me feel a little better to know it is the medicine and maybe it will get better when I stop taking it. My five years are up in October with this drug. I always feel like I am alone with these horrible side effects. My son did make a salve with St. John's wart and rubs my feet. I always get relief. He has me on cod liver oil and other supplements, ghee for vitamin k2, magnesium etc. I feel like a big baby because I still take Motrin and up to two norco to get around
Posts.Title: Trigger Thumb from Arimidex?

Posts.Content: I had a dbl masectomy five years ago. I finally have started to really work out, P90 to be exact, and have found out how truly weak my upper body is. I also have a lot of soreness around my surgery site, so am doing the second month every other day. Has anyone had results with a workout program that you want to share? After the first month, I can now do a few push ups!! I also do mine now up against the wall, so I can keep going.
Posts.Title: Post masectomy discomfort after exercise
